DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to describe the character of a woman's menstrual cycle flow. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to menstrual cycle description._The motion characteristic of fluids and gases; the amount of fluid that flows in a given time, e.g. through an body organ or part, expressed as volume per unit of time (called also flow rate)._Description; a statement that represents something in words.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: The motion characteristic of fluids and gases; the amount of fluid that flows in a given time, e.g. through an body organ or part, expressed as volume per unit of time (called also flow rate).:Description; a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the patient's ability to conceive or nurse offspring and/or their current reproductive status.

ReferenceDocuments.description: Thinking of the last year, how would you describe the flow of your period?
